questions.question: Which of the following is not a reason why the IR began in England?

choices.answer: England had a large amount of Natural Resources
England was the richest country at the time
England was politically stable and had a national bank
England had a large labor force due to agricultural changes

questions.question: Which of the following was not a new technology of the IR?
What problems did the Industrial Revolution create in the working place?

choices.answer: An increase in education for children

questions.question: Which economic system uses competition and a Laissez-faire approach?
Which of the following was a not a solution to the problems caused by industrialization?
Which of the following things made the French people angry at King Louis?

choices.answer: The king gave a large amount of money to the nobles
He wouldn't stop singing in the Jungle Book play
He spent 25% of the country's money on Versailles
He ate too much cake and became fat

questions.question: Why did the tax system make the French people angry?

choices.answer: A. They believed it was taxation without representation
B. The 1st and 2nd estate never really had to pay taxes
C. They were starving and could barely afford bread

questions.question: Which of the following was not a reason for Napoleon's downfall?

choices.answer: His army didn't respect him any more

questions.question: How did Napoleon show the people he supported the revolution's ideas?

choices.answer: He made the tax system more fair
He threw a party and gave everyone a piece of cake

questions.question: Which leader of France believed that in order to achieve virtue, there must be terror?
"we need a government we can trust to protect our lives and properties through a contract"
Which of the following is not a "Natural Right" that Locke said the government should protect?
Why was the Glorious Revolution significant?

choices.answer: The new government had more representation from the people

questions.question: "Leaders should be feared but not hated" who would most agree with this statement?
How did Robert Owen and socialism attempt to fix the problems of the IR?

choices.answer: He tried to even out the wealth distribution
He pulled students out of the school system to work

questions.question: What is a laissez-faire approach?

choices.answer: The dictator controls all aspects of the economy
There are not economic laws or rules
The rich are taxed higher than the poor
The government is not actively involved in the economy

questions.question: How did Unions try and fix the problems created by the IR

choices.answer: Bargain with the boss to get better wages
Threaten the boss with assassination if they don't change
Challenge the boss to a duel
Ask the boss for longer hours so the employees get more $$$

questions.question: Ms. Brown pays $0 to see the doctor but pays fairly high taxes, what system is this?
Mrs. Nelson opens an ice cream shop and pays her workers minimum wage to try and make a profit

choices.answer: Someone should bring us ice cream for free

questions.question: Why did the steam engine help start the IR?

choices.answer: It led to using steam to power machines
It led to the steamboat and quicker transportation of goods
It led to using less coal
It led to using less people in the factories

questions.question: What were some positive outcomes of the IR?
What was the purpose of the Declaration of the Rights of Man

choices.answer: To protect the people's rights from the king
To support no taxation w/o representation
To give the Assembly more power

questions.question: Why did the French people want to execute King Louis?

choices.answer: He kept the National Assembly from meeting to make changes
He gave the rich too much money

questions.question: Why did the French storm the bastille?

choices.answer: To show the king they were mad and wanted changes to be made

questions.question: Which of the following statements would Hobbes agree with?

choices.answer: People are selfish and need a strong government to rule them
A leader should be feared but not hated
The government should protect life, liberty and property
